Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[tests] Xamarin.ProjectTools fix for IsTargetSkipped" (#2287) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/pull/2285

The `IsTargetSkipped` method has a slight bug, it doesn't account for:

    Skipping target "_GenerateJavaDesignerForComponent" because it has no inputs.

Minor change here to account for either `inputs` or `outputs` in the
message. There are no test failures caused by this on master; this was
discoverd in #2285 on d15-9.

Switched to using C# string interpolation.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Fastdev no longer works for certain projects on second unchanged deployment attempt" (#2216) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
A legacy amalgamation of test cases used in a fastdev test scenario is no longer working as expected. This application is now being fully re-installed on a second unchanged installation attempt. I'm seeing this on both macOS and Windows. I've attached a similar repro using an XA template with a handful of play services / support NuGets, a wearable 1.0 project, and Android class project references.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Download the attached project: [App32.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/files/2413092/App32.zip)
2. Restore NuGet packages.
3. `msbuild /t:Install App32\App32\App32.csproj`
4. `msbuild /t:Install App32\App32\App32.csproj`

<!--
If you have a repro project, you may drag & drop the .zip/etc. onto the issue editor to attach it.
-->

### Expected Behavior
A sequential unchanged installation attempt should re-deploy almost immediately.

### Actual Behavior
The `BuildApk` and `InstallPackageAssemblies` tasks execute in full, when `BuildApk` should be skipped entirely. The previous version of the apk is uninstalled and replaced with the newly built version. This is a regression as compared to d15-9 preview and d15-8 stable releases.

### Version Information
Xamarin.Android SDK   9.1.99.26 (HEAD/225afd531)
<!--
1. On macOS and within Visual Studio, select Visual Studio > About Visual Studio, then click the Show Details button, then click the Copy Information button.

2. Paste below this comment block.
-->

### Log File
https://gist.githubusercontent.com/pjcollins/51cc04a093dd06727f2247a70ad68d67/raw/cb6b0c6ff827ffb7b1669e25ae8f5ac2511efcda/gistfile1.txt
http://xqa.blob.core.windows.net/gist/report-735652c843e94f199972da9a9e76cc73.txt

> VS bug [#690758](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/690758)

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Bump to xamarin/Java.Interop/master@8ee34a35" (#2286) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Fixes: https://github.com/xamarin/java.interop/issues/373
Fixes: https://github.com/xamarin/java.interop/issues/374

Fix `jnimarshalmethod-gen.exe` to not use the method cache for methods
from generic types.

Update `jnimarshalmethod-gen.exe` to load assemblies using a full
path.  This appears to be required with mono/mono:2018-06.

Remove 49 warnings from the Java.Interop build.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[build] Generate separate .binlog files for tests." (#2001) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/issues/1792
Context: 987a05fa890b8a24513820942f2c134099273950

Commit 987a05fa updated the "normal" build log process, as used by
Jenkins/etc., so that Console output received "normal" build verbosity
messages, while MSBuild `.binlog` files would be generated so that
"diagnostic" build logs could be produced "later," as necessary.

Unfortunately, commit 987a05fa didn't update unit test builds.
Consequently, `make run-apk-tests`/etc. would emit *diagnostic* build
logs to the Console, meaning instead of the previous ~1GB log file, we
instead had a "mere" ~400MB instead.

Update test execution so that they follow the spirit of 987a05fa:
`.binlog` files for diagnostic output, with "normal" output printed to
the console, resulting in smaller Jenkins log files.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "The `armeabi` deprecation warning is displayed for default Debug builds in d15-9" (#2289) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Find a project which does not override `<AndroidSupportedAbis>` and build it in Debug mode.
(e.g. https://github.com/xamarin/monodroid-samples/blob/master/HelloWorld/HelloWorld.csproj)

<!--
If you have a repro project, you may drag & drop the .zip/etc. onto the issue editor to attach it.
-->

### Expected Behavior
The deprecation warning for `armeabi` should only be displayed when the user has explicitly chosen to support this ABI. Default debug builds should not display this warning, as no action needs to be taken. This scenario will automatically be resolved in a future release when the debug-specific default value for `AndroidSupportedAbis` is changed to exclude `armeabi`. 

### Actual Behavior
Debug builds are displaying a warning about the usage of armeabi[0], because in d15-9, `armeabi` is still included in the debug-specific default value of `AndroidSupportedAbis`.

[0] ```C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\Preview\Enterprise\MSBuild\Xamarin\Android\Xamarin.Android.Common.targets(503,2): warning XA0115: This ABI ('armeabi') is deprecated and will be removed
 in the next release. Please update your project properties.```
### Version Information
Xamarin.Android.Sdk.9.1.0.35
<!--
1. On macOS and within Visual Studio, select Visual Studio > About Visual Studio, then click the Show Details button, then click the Copy Information button.

2. Paste below this comment block.
-->

1. On macOS and within Visual Studio:
    a. Click **Tools** > **SDK Command Prompt**.
    b. Within the launched `Terminal.app` window, run:

            adb logcat -d | pbcopy

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[iOS] After Cell.ForceUpdateSize(), contained Entry has odd text entry behaviour" (#4067) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
After calling ForceUpdateSize() on a ViewCell with an Entry control, the keyboard hides after typing a character. If the Entry Text is bound, it only accepts 1 character.

Sample XAML: 
```
<ListView x:Name="listView" HasUnevenRows="True">
    <ListView.ItemsSource>
        <x:Array Type="{x:Type x:String}">
            <x:String>A</x:String>
            <x:String>B</x:String>
        </x:Array>
    </ListView.ItemsSource>
    <ListView.ItemTemplate>
        <DataTemplate>
            <ViewCell>
                <Entry />
            </ViewCell>
        </DataTemplate>
    </ListView.ItemTemplate>
</ListView>
```

Codebehind calls ForceUpdateSize() on the first entry in MainPage_OnAppearing:
listView.TemplatedItems.First().ForceUpdateSize();

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Compile and run attached iOS solution
2. Select first Entry in ListView, try enter text.
3. Notice second Entry in ListView behaves normally.

### Expected Behavior
Keyboard should remain open, and bound data should reflect typed data.

### Actual Behavior
Keyboard closes after single character entry, bound data is cleared and set to last typed character (multiple times).

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: Xamarin.Forms versions 3.2.0.871581, 3.3.0.871608-pre2
- Last known good version:
- IDE: VS 15.8.7
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - iOS: 12.0.1 <!-- The version of the iOS SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 11.1 -->
  - Android Support Library Version: <!-- if applicable -->
- Nuget Packages:
- Affected Devices: Tested on an iPhone 7

### Screenshots

<!-- If the issue is a visual issue, please include screenshots showing the problem if possible -->

### Reproduction Link
[BasicXam.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/2470636/BasicXam.zip)

<!-- Please upload or provide a link to a reproduction case -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "iOS ViewCell subcontrols use Selected BackgroundColor as their BackgroundColor" (#4066) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
On iOS, control background colors (Entry, Button at least) are set by the ViewCell background when the ViewCell is selected in a ListView control. 

Sample ListView setup is:
```
<ListView HasUnevenRows="True">
    <ListView.ItemsSource>
        <x:Array Type="{x:Type x:String}">
            <x:String>A</x:String>
            <x:String>B</x:String>
            <x:String>C</x:String>
            <x:String>D</x:String>
        </x:Array>
    </ListView.ItemsSource>
    <ListView.ItemTemplate>
        <DataTemplate>
            <ViewCell Height="160">
                <Entry VerticalOptions="Center" />
            </ViewCell>
        </DataTemplate>
    </ListView.ItemTemplate>
</ListView>
```

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Build and run attached iOS solution
2. Select a ViewCell by tapping on the ViewCell (and not directly into the Entry)
3. The Entry background uses the default Selected grey background of the ViewCell

### Expected Behavior
Controls should retain their background color.
### Actual Behavior
Control background switches to the selected row background color when selected (returns to correct color when deselected)

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: Xamarin.Forms versions 3.2.0.871581, 3.3.0.871608-pre2
- Last known good version:
- IDE: VS 15.8.7
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - iOS:  12.0.1<!-- The version of the iOS SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 11.1 -->
- Nuget Packages:
- Affected Devices: Tested on an iPhone 7

### Screenshots
![entrybackgroundissue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4073820/46830145-c977c880-cd6d-11e8-819f-cd75b9e1606e.jpg)

<!-- If the issue is a visual issue, please include screenshots showing the problem if possible -->

### Reproduction Link
[BasicXam.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/2470490/BasicXam.zip)

<!-- Please upload or provide a link to a reproduction case -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[iOS] Could not load file or assembly 'System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations'" (#4065) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi,
I have my Mobile XF App and a website in the same solution. They both share a .NET Stadard library project, where i store all the common DTOs.
Some DTOs have DataAnnotations used by the website.

In Android everything works fine, but in **iOS** I get this exception:

> "Could not load file or assembly 'System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35' or one of its dependencies."

I get it when I try to login consuming the API, and then serialize the Json result into the DTO:

`var apiResult = JsonConvert.DeserializeObject<T>(responseJson);`

This is an issue only when is a DTO with annotations.

I manually installed **System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations** in all my mobile projects, to see if it would fix anything, but it didn't.
I really don't want to duplicate all the DTOs in my Mobile App too, is that the only way?

For the record this is happening on the Simulator, and I am using the latest **Xamarin Forms v3.2.0.871581**.

Thanks so much for any help.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Feedback] xamarin.forms imeoptions in xaml not working" (#4064) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

In https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-forms-samples/blob/master/UserInterface/PlatformSpecifics/PlatformSpecifics/Android/XAML/AndroidEntryPage.xaml the android ImeOptions is set to Send. When you go that page on your android device and don't select anything else in the picker, setting the focus in the entrybox should give the send button, but it doesn't. Also if I try to set it in code behind in the constructor or OnAppearing() with entry.On<Android>().SetImeOptions(ImeFlags.Send); it does not work. When you put a button on the page and put this code in the Clicked event it does work. Tried it on android 7.0 and 7.1.2

View on Developer Community
To find diagnostic information, see the original linked feedback ticket. ### Source [702658](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/702658)

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Bump mono." (#4971) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Commit list for mono/mono:

* mono/mono@2343f267067 [sdks] Add cmake toolchain file for LLVM MXE builds (#11056)
* mono/mono@46b723d6b01 [2018-06] [sdks] Create archive targets for pre-building on CI (#10936)
* mono/mono@ab3c897d685 Merge pull request #10997 from lewurm/2018-06-interp-fixes-for-native-type
* mono/mono@914a62ab2e7 [interp] introduce float R4 stack type
* mono/mono@62f23a83652 [interp] support ntype.ToString ()
* mono/mono@2c48c62e66f [interp] support nfloat.*Infinity
* mono/mono@5c5a48b1449 [interp] support ntype.Equals ()
* mono/mono@13e412ee52a [interp] support ntype.CompareTo ()

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "MonoMacGameView not rendering on Mojave" (#4959) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Download Mac sample app [MonoMacGameView](https://developer.xamarin.com/samples/mac/MonoMacGameWindow/)
2. Compile and run the sample

### Expected Behavior
See the cube and the pyramid rendering correctly
Prior to updating to Xamarin.Mac 5, this was working on Mojave. We have an app that is having an identical problem to the sample.

### Actual Behavior
The screen has no rendered content
![screen shot 2018-10-09 at 1 13 13 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1158332/46695838-7400b780-cbc5-11e8-9478-7d25b07ae38f.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "AppKit outputs some messages (such as autolayout errors) to Console log not stdout/err and don't appears in IDE" (#4433) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

- Create a simple XM app with an autolayout conflict
- Run from IDE, note no warnings/errors
- Run from command line, same
- Open console, and search, you'll see them here.

It appears Xcode is doing some magic to fold these into the output pane.

See example in https://forums.xamarin.com/discussion/129187/enable-autolayout-diagnosis-messages-in-debug-output?

### Expected Behavior
We should see these messages that show up in Xcode

### Actual Behavior
No messages

> VS bug [#645966](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/645966), VS bug [#680551](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/680551)
